title: Bug 21706BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
description: Bug 21706BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
OB: The BidiUtil class in win32 is using Class.forName() in its implementation.
EB: Add a private constructor to the BidiUtil class. There are no non-static methods in this class, so it would be a good practice to prevent people from instantiating the class unnecessarily. This change does not add any additional size because the compiler automatically provides a free public constructor. By making the constructor private, we ensure that the class cannot be instantiated.
SR: To resolve the issue, change the line above to: static Callback callback = new Callback(new BidiUtil().getClass(), "windowProc", 4); This change should achieve the same functionality as before.
